description:
CUDAfy is an SDK that permits general purpose programming of NVIDIA CUDA Graphics Processing Units (GPUs) and OpenCL devices completely from within the Microsoft .NET framework.  Device code and host code can be written in .NET using standard .NET types. There are also wrappers for the CUDA Random, FFT and BLAS libraries.

For CUDA development the NVIDIA CUDA 5.0 Toolkit must be installed.  For OpenCL the relevant SDK from Intel, AMD or Altera must be installed.

For first time users it is recommended to download the installer / set-up tool from http://www.hybriddsp.com.
releaseNotes:
Fix: Handle non-public members
Add: OpenCL as an architecture
Add: Support for Infinite and NaN
Fix: Handing of structs in OpenCL
Fix: Make GMath.PI and GMath.E const
Fix: Formatting of floating points
Add: OpenCL support - target AMD GPUs and Intel CPUs
Add: Integer intrinsics
Add: Can now specify a null in list of types to cudafy.
Fix: GMath.E and GMath.PI did not translate to floating point versions
Fix: Unicode handling for CUDA when writing a string on device
Fix: Nested structs and structs referenced within a struct broken
